verses.verse: And Miriam <WH4813> and Aaron <WH175> spoke <WH1696> against Moses <WH4872> because of <WH182> the Ethiopian <WH3571> woman <WH802> whom he had married <WH3947>: for he had married <WH3947> an Ethiopian <WH3571> woman <WH802>.
And they said <WH559>, Has the Lord <WH3068> indeed spoken <WH1696> only by Moses <WH4872>? has he not spoken <WH1696> also by us <WH3068>? And the Lord heard it <WH8085>.
(Now the man <WH376> Moses <WH4872> was very <WH3966> meek <WH6035>, above all the men <WH120> which were upon the face <WH6440> of the earth <WH127>.)

And the Lord <WH3068> spoke <WH559> suddenly <WH6597> unto Moses <WH4872>, and unto Aaron <WH175>, and unto Miriam <WH4813>, Come out <WH3318> you three <WH7969> unto the tabernacle <WH168> of the congregation <WH4150>. And they three <WH7969> came out <WH3318>.

And the Lord <WH3068> came down <WH3381> in the pillar <WH5982> of the cloud <WH6051>, and stood <WH5975> in the door <WH6607> of the tabernacle <WH168>, and called <WH7121> Aaron <WH175> and Miriam <WH4813>: and they both <WH8147> came forth <WH3318>.

And he said <WH559>, Hear <WH8085> now my words <WH1697>: If there be a prophet <WH5030> among you <WH3068>, I the Lord will make myself known <WH3045> unto him in a vision <WH4759>, and will speak <WH1696> unto him in a dream <WH2472>.
My servant <WH5650> Moses <WH4872> is not so <WH539>, who is faithful in all my house <WH1004>.

With him will I speak <WH1696> mouth <WH6310> to mouth <WH6310>, even plainly <WH4758>, and not in dark speeches <WH2420>; and the form <WH8544> of the Lord <WH3068> shall he behold <WH5027>: why then were you not afraid <WH3372> to speak <WH1696> against my servant <WH5650> Moses <WH4872>?
And the anger <WH639> of the Lord <WH3068> was kindled <WH2734> against them <WH3212>; and he departed.

And the cloud <WH6051> departed <WH5493> from off the tabernacle <WH168>; and <WH4813>, behold, Miriam became leprous <WH6879>, white as snow <WH7950>: and Aaron <WH175> looked <WH6437> upon Miriam <WH4813>, and <WH6879>, behold, she was leprous.

And Aaron <WH175> said <WH559> unto Moses <WH4872>, Alas <WH994>, my lord <WH113>, I beg you <WH7896>, lay not the sin <WH2403> upon us <WH2973>, where we have done foolishly, and where we have sinned <WH2398>.
Let her not be as one dead <WH4994>, of whom the flesh <WH1320> is half <WH2677> consumed <WH398> when he comes out <WH3318> of his mother <WH517>'s womb <WH7358>.
And Moses <WH4872> cried <WH6817> unto the Lord <WH3068>, saying <WH559>, Heal <WH7495> her now <WH410>, O God, I beg you.

And the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> unto Moses <WH4872>, If her father <WH1> had but <WH3417> spit <WH3417> in her face <WH6440>, should she not be ashamed <WH3637> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>? let her be shut <WH5462> out <WH2351> from the camp <WH4264> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>, and after <WH310> that let her be received in again <WH622>.

And Miriam <WH4813> was shut <WH5462> out <WH2351> from the camp <WH4264> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>: and the people <WH5971> journeyed <WH5265> not until Miriam <WH4813> was brought in again <WH622>.
And afterward <WH310> the people <WH5971> removed <WH5265> from Hazeroth <WH2698>, and pitched <WH2583> in the wilderness <WH4057> of Paran <WH6290>.
